input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: SECO STAATSSEKRETARIAT FÜR WIRTSCHAFT - INTERNATIONALE ARBEITSFRAGEN DAIN. Summary: National Action Plan on Business and Human Rights 2024-2027. Description: Objective: To promote dialogue between stakeholders in order to strengthen the implementation of human rights in the practices of Swiss companies. Activities: · (Measure 3) Organise the third national forum on business and human rights in 2026 and roundtable discussions involving companies, academia, non-governmental organisations, the public sector and international organisations. · (Measure 5 reinforced) Ensuring the transfer of knowledge and best practices between the various actors. In doing so: o Promote dialogue between stakeholders, including business associations and civil society, by supporting roundtable discussions and discussion platforms. The aim is to promote constructive cooperation by developing practical solutions for better respect for human rights in business activities. The focus here is primarily on multi-stakeholder initiatives in the cocoa, gold, sustainable textiles and coffee sectors, as well as on the implementation of the Voluntary Principles on Security and Human Rights and the International Code of Conduct for Private Security Service Providers, in which Switzerland already plays an active role. <br> Doc Title: National Action Plan on Business and Human Rights 2024-2027 <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-07-28. Closing Date: 2025-09-08. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: UNIVERSITÄT ZÜRICH ASSETMANAGEMENT. Summary: Cro Services Pool. Description: UZH invites companies to submit competitive offers for the following procurement need: CRO services for compound synthesis, ADME, PK and non-GLP tox studies. Recolony specializes in the identification of new disease targets through in-depth analysis of the host-microbiota interactions. For the present project, Recolony is developing a novel small molecule immunotherapy for cancer. For this purpose, Recolony is looking for CRO support for compound synthesis, ADME (Absorption, Distribution, Metabolism, and Excretion) and PK (pharmacokinetics) studies, non-GLP tox studies and in vivo efficacy studies. The exact work packages that are needed cannot be defined upfront due to the exploratory nature of the project. Therefore, this public tender is evaluating CROs to become members in a pool of framework agreement partners by passing a suitability check and signing a Master Service Agreement (MSA). Members within that pool can apply for work packages thereafter via the process of mini tender. These work packages will be defined and tendered on an ongoing basis for the duration of the project. <br> Doc Title: CRO Services Pool <br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-05-14. Closing Date: 2025-06-23. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: UNIVERSITÄT ZÜRICH ASSETMANAGEMENT
output.Summary: Cro Services Pool

Summary: Ur_01074-02 for the Implementation of the Project Support Partnership for Seco-S Trade Pro-Motion 2024-2028. Description: The objective of project support partnerships (PS-P) is to enhance SECO-s Trade Promotion Section (WEHU) by strengthening its operational capacities and knowledge base, improving trade promotion performance and sustainability. PS-P will bolster WEHU-s project cycle capabilities - identification, preparation, steering, and evaluation - with substantive technical inputs. Additionally, PS-P will refine intervention strategies, providing specific insights on WEHU-s positioning in areas like international value chains and the WTO's impact on developing countries. PS-P aims to amplify the development impact of WEHU-s trade promotion operations. A description of the four thematic lots as well as specific tasks within the respective lot can be found in the tender document. <br> Doc Title: UR_01074-02 for the implementation of the Project Support Partnership for SECO-s Trade Pro-motion 2024-2028 <br> Contract Type: services. Summary: Industrial Day Almost Swiss Federal Railways Sbb Division Infrastructure, Project Fast. Description: SBB is carrying out the project almost (Full Automation Specification Testing). In this context, European standards are examined for their suitability in Swiss rail traffic. The project thus conducts basic work for future application projects. The basis for these examinations is the ATO specifications from the TSI-2023, as well as the specifications “Shift2rail Up to Goa4”, the publication of Shift2Rail has been announced for the end of February 2024. With the project in the “Innovation Pillar” of the EU Rail (Europe-s Rail Joint Undertaking), the SBB is integrated as “Associated Partner”, a European research program as part of Horizon Europe. The project delivers defined delivery items for the EU Rail, and also the client BAV. Since the SBB as a Swiss company is not entitled to EU funding, it can receive supporting funding from the SBFI (State Secretariat for Education, Research and Innovation) under certain framework conditions. , With the following key points: -The cooperation he .... instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: ALLIANCE SWISSPASS. Summary: Rfi - Project Feldtest Travel Entry Verein Ch -integral. Description: In the sense of a market analysis, this Request for Information (RFI) pursues the clarification of the following main questions: market situation:- What potential providers of smartphone-based location systems for automatic travel acquisition is there today (ticketing and experience in the public transport are no prerequisites for participation)?- Are the participating companies available as a development partner for a potential future industry-owned solution for travel acquisition? Quality of the travel entry:- How exactly are the different location systems for automatic travel recording based on the different methods and technologies (such as with and without beacons)? Measures have to be taken to ensure the quality for a successful nationwide use as a ticketing system? Anonymity:- What options are there from the perspective of the participating companies for anonymous automatic travel acquisition?. Published Date: 2023-11-16. Closing Date: 2023-12-15. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: ALLIANCE SWISSPASS
output.Summary: Rfi - Project Feldtest Travel Entry Verein Ch -integral
output.Description: In the sense of a market analysis, this Request for Information (RFI) pursues the clarification of the following main questions: market situation:- What potential providers of smartphone-based location systems for automatic travel acquisition is there today (ticketing and experience in the public transport are no prerequisites for participation)?- Are the participating companies available as a development partner for a potential future industry-owned solution for travel acquisition? Quality of the travel entry:- How exactly are the different location systems for automatic travel recording based on the different methods and technologies (such as with and without beacons)? Measures have to be taken to ensure the quality for a successful nationwide use as a ticketing system? Anonymity:- What options are there from the perspective of the participating companies for anonymous automatic travel acquisition?

input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL OFFICE OF ENERGY SFOE ENERGY RESEARCH AND CLEANTECH. Summary: Program Analysis and Impact Analysis Sweet (Swiss Energy Research for the Energy Transition). Description: The subject of this procurement is an evaluation of the SWEET funding program. The evaluation includes a program analysis (i.e. an analysis of the program concept, the program processes and the program specifications) and an impact analysis. For the present tender, the client is looking forVia a service provider who will carry out the work in the period 2024-2027. The goal of the evaluation is to gain insights that can be used to optimize the program. This includes adjustments to the concept, the processes and the specifications in order to implement the program eto make it more effective (to increase its impact) and to make it more efficient (to reduce the administrative effort for all involved bodies with the same effect).<br> Doc Title: Research and experimental development services<br> Contract Type: Services. input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: FEDERAL OFFICE FOR THE ENVIRONMENT FOEN, DEPARTMENT OF NOISE AND NIS. Summary: Promotion of Research on the Effects of Non-Ionizing Radiation on Health and the Environment. Description: The call for tenders is intended to deliver results from research projects. The research projects relate to health issues or general questions about the biological effects of high- and low-frequency NIS. Investigations on NIR exposures in the high-frequency rangen refer to previous and/or new frequencies and signal characteristics. The research projects can include various scientific sectors, including: model studies, studies on biological effects, dosimetry in relation to biological or health effects, mechanisms of action, epidemiological or clinical studies, studies on environmental impact.<br> Research proposals are divided into two modules:<br> Module 1: model studies, studies on biological effects, dosimetry or mechanisms of action <br> Module 2: epidemiological and clinical studies, studies on environmental impact.<br> Doc Title: Research and development services and related consultancy services<br> Contract Type: Services. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Switzerland. Purchaser Name: INTERPEACE. Summary: Human Rights and Peacebuilding Research. Description: Request for proposals are invited for Human Rights and Peacebuilding Research    Scope of the Assignment    The consultant organisation, research team or individual(s), will carry out a series of interviews with programme staff, local practitioners, human rights defenders, activists and others working at the intersection of human rights and peacebuilding in both peacebuilding organisations and human rights organisations. The final output will be a report or series of separate reports dependent on discussions with Interpeace. The work will be carried out over the course of four months during 2021.    Key interviewees could include but are not limited to:    Members of various UN agencies working on human rights or at the nexus of peacebuilding and human rights.  Local Civil Society representatives in various parts of society working on peacebuilding and human rights.  Expert practitioners and academics with in-depth knowledge of both conceptual and operational issues at the heart of the peacebuilding-human rights nexus  Timeframe    Commence Mid-April  Research design and set up by Mid-May  30-40 Interviews by mid-July  Drafting and revisions by Mid-August  Completed report/s end August    How to apply:  Interpeace invites qualified persons to submit an Expression of Interest (EOI) to provide the services described above. The call is open to individuals as well as to institutions and companies which wish to propose achieving the objectives and deliverables of this consultancy in alternative ways.    Applicants shall bear all costs associated with the preparation and submission of their proposal, and Interpeace shall not be responsible or liable for those costs, whether direct or indirect, regardless of the conduct or outcome of the EOI, nor if the vacancy is cancelled, altered or postponed for any reason. This includes, but is not limited to, any and all costs incurred for pre-proposal clarifications, oral presentations, site visits, and subsequent meetings and negotiations.    All Expressions of Interest shall be prepared in English and comprise the following documents:    Motivational Letter, explaining why this topic is of interest to the candidate.  Track Record, including past professional experience within the areas of expertise described above, examples of work, and contact details of three references.  Financial Proposal, containing a proposed all-inclusive, daily consultancy rate in USD. The cost of preparing an application and negotiating a contract, including any related travel, is not reimbursable nor can it be included as a direct cost of the assignment.  All offers to provide the services described in this Expression of Interest must be submitted by e-mail to Graeme Simpson by 20 April 2021 at simpson@interpeace.org    All submissions must indicate “**Human Rights and Peacebuilding Research”** in the subject line.    Only applications under consideration will be notified. Participation in this EOI indicates acceptance of the terms and conditions provided.. Tender Value: 0. Published Date: 2021-04-12. Closing Date: 2021-04-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Other Funding Agencies

output.Purchaser_Name: INTERPEACE
